column4: Hey. Does anyone know how to "burn" a bootable ISO to a USB drive? It's not a Linux ISO, so I can't use the startup disk creator.
But it's mounted and files on it are readable
What ISO is it anyway? Bootable ISO?
Oh you want USB or something?
That script you showed me did put the files on the disc, but it's not bootable.
I wonder if gparted can make it bootable. I'm looking at gparted at the moment.
I see. There are flags in gparted that you can toggle on to 'boot'
Take it out and plug it in aain.
Try and unmount it (right-click) and reload gparted. After that, I'll be... in same boat with you.
